Does WCP’s x2i swerve support a kraken x60 drive motor and neov1.1 as an azimuth motor?

docs.wcproducts.com

Advanced Features | WCP Swerve X2

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-04-09T15:55:06.931Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":121,"readers_count":120,"score":29.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":498582,"topic_slug":"question-regarding-support-for-kraken-drive-neo-steer-swerve","display_username":"Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.wcproducts.com/wcp-swerve-x2/overview-and-features/advanced-features","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Advanced Features | WCP Swerve X2","clicks":17}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48664,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor 5503"},"post_url":"/t/question-regarding-support-for-kraken-drive-neo-steer-swerve/498582/2","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3585248,"name":"","username":"TheBatman","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thebatman/{size}/255139_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-09T16:07:37.341Z","cooked":"

From what i read - in the link provided it states that the module supports kraken motors for drive and steer, and neo motors for drive and steer - but it doesnt state that it supports a kraken drive and neo steer (at the same time).
The reason im asking this is because if i try to buy a module - it asks me whether i want 8mm splinexs motor shaft or 8mm key motor shafts, but if i have a kraken drive and neo steer - i want both.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-04-09T16:07:37.341Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":102,"readers_count":101,"score":25.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":498582,"topic_slug":"question-regarding-support-for-kraken-drive-neo-steer-swerve","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":48664,"username":"RicDV","name":"Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ricdv/{size}/188502_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71857,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Vigilante"},"post_url":"/t/question-regarding-support-for-kraken-drive-neo-steer-swerve/498582/3","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3585253,"name":"Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons","username":"RicDV","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ricdv/{size}/188502_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-09T16:10:23.435Z","cooked":"

I get it…I would order the 8mm separately. You would have extra splinex for the Kraken…just in case.

Im also wondering regarding other modules,
I assume the WCP X2t modules support kraken drive and neo azimuth the same way.
Do SDS mk4i and mk4n also support kraken drive and neo azimuth (assuming i buy an extra pinion kit)?
